Utterance: <sync>
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing well, actually! I’ve been focusing on my jewelry and keeping up with my journaling.
That’s wonderful! How has the journaling been going for you?
I’ve been writing more about my boundaries and how to maintain them.
That’s a valuable focus. Have you noticed any changes in how you approach your son or your husband?
Yes, I feel more centered. I’m not letting their issues take over my emotions as much.
That’s a significant shift. How does it feel to maintain those boundaries?
It feels freeing, but I still struggle with guilt sometimes.
It’s normal to feel that way. What strategies have you found helpful when guilt arises?
I remind myself of the affirmations we talked about, and I try to focus on the positives.
That’s a great approach. What positives have you noticed lately?
I’ve been more patient with my kids, and I feel more in control of my emotions.
That’s fantastic! Have you had a chance to check in with your husband as planned?
Yes, we had our first check-in last week, and it went really well.
I’m glad to hear that! What did you discuss during your check-in?
We talked about our stressors and how we can support each other better.
That’s a great step forward. How do you feel about the communication you both had?
It felt good to be open and honest. I think it brought us closer.
That’s a beautiful outcome! How can you continue to build on that connection?
I think we can keep having these regular check-ins and maybe even do something fun together.
That sounds like a wonderful idea! What kind of activities do you think you’d enjoy together?
Maybe a date night or even just cooking together.
Those are great options! How do you think that time together will impact your relationship?
I think it’ll help us reconnect and relieve some of the tension.
Absolutely! It’s essential to nurture your relationship. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about my son’s situation again.
It’s understandable to feel anxious. What specifically is causing that anxiety?
I’m worried about his future and how this experience will affect him.
Those worries are valid. Have you found any coping strategies to manage that anxiety?
I’ve been trying to focus on what I can control and letting go of what I can’t.
That’s a healthy mindset. How can you remind yourself of that when anxiety arises?
I think I could write it down as a mantra and keep it somewhere visible.
That’s a great idea! Having reminders can help ground you. How do you feel about our session today?
I feel optimistic and more equipped to handle everything.
That’s wonderful to hear! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s continue to build on this in our next session.
Thank you! I appreciate your support.
